snippet: Newt Gingrich's involvement with Forstmann Little could complicate his attacks on Mitt Romney as a heartless leveraged buyout executive for his years at Bain Capital.
abstract: Newt Gingrich's involvement with Forstmann Little could complicate his attacks on Mitt Romney as a heartless leveraged buyout executive for his years at Bain Capital.
lead_paragraph: Newt Gingrich has ramped up his attacks on Mitt Romney as a heartless leveraged buyout executive for his years at Bain Capital. But Mr. Gingrich was himself on an advisory board for Forstmann Little, a pioneering private equity firm that had a similar business model, Peter Lattman and Jim Rutenberg report on The Caucus. Mr. Gingrich's involvement with the firm could complicate his attacks on Mr. Romney. Read more »

headline.main: Gingrich's Own Close Tie to Buyout Industry
